column4: Howdy all.  Is there a way to rerun the xorg configuration now that I have hooked up my external LCD monitor to my laptop?
you mean something like "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg"?
I don't know.  Would that detect my external monitor?
btw: if your graphics driver supports it, xrandr is just great for setting up external displays
it is an integrated nvidia 7 series
do you use the proprietary driver?
i have backed up my xorg.conf and i'll try the command you gave
yes
you could try nvidia-settings
okay nvidia-settings is just showing 1 screen..shouldn't I have two?
i'm an old gentoo user so config files don't care me...so if you have any ideas let me know :)
s/care/scare
afaik dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg should recognize all monitors
okay thanks i'll give that a try
but i haven't tried it myself
okay nvidia-settings see is and wants to know if I want - seperate x screen or twinview
wouldn't i want seperate x screen?
with twinview the desktop is extended and you can move windows between the screens
just plugging in the screen and rebooting doesn't help?
what was the command again to reconfigure xserver?
works awesome after a reboot
i'm now in 1280x1024 on a seperate x screen thanks guys
when only one screen is used at a time, rebooting is usually enough
